metadata.title: CVE-2016-1685 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
core/fxge/ge/fx_ge_text.cpp in PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before51.0.2704.63, miscalculates certain index values, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a craftedPDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121').
